overview.problemStatement: Let $\epsilon>0$ and $\omega(n)$ count the number of distinct prime factors of $n$. Are there infinitely many values of $n$ such that\[\omega(n-k) 0$. View the LaTeX source This page was last edited 12 January 2026.
